results.title: Taj Mahal
results.creator_credit: Documentary Films of India and James Ramiessenger
results.brief_description: A study of the Taj Mahal in Agra. An impression of the interior and exterior of the old mausoleum, and the surrounding gardens; story of Shar Jahan and the erection of Taj Mahal to the memory of his wife; the blending of Saracenic and Hindu styles in the architecture; the inlay work in some precious stones, marble bas-reliefs and the lace-like marble screens around the tombs.

results.title: Taiwan; South Korea
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Nihon Hoso Kyokai, Leo Eaton, Fumihiko Ninomiya, Richard Carey and David Rabinovitch
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Mini Dragons”.
Although Taiwan is in many ways an exemplary example of an Asian country which has boomed economically whilst diminishing the gap between the rich and the poor, it suffers from political power being held undemocratically by the ruling KMT party, a historical legacy, uncontrolled pollution and the influence of Japan. South Korea, on the other hand, has the largest gap between the rich and poor causing political unrest and violent protest, which along with increased competition from other rising economic powers in Asia may end South Korea’s era of economic success.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Film Australia, Nihon Hoso Kyokai, Leo Eaton, Fumihiko Ninomiya, Richard Carey and David Rabinovitch

results.title: Tail of a Tiger
results.creator_credit: James M. Vernon and Rolf De Heer
results.brief_description: Like all young kids, Orville Ryan is desperate to be part of a group. Unfortunately, the one he tries to gain acceptance from, is the local gang of neighbourhood bullies! And “this little dag” just doesn’t belong with them. So he is picked on, chased and battered. But through all this unfairness he happens upon an eccentric old man, who is given a hard time by the same boys. The two of them strike up a relationship based on their similar love for the freedom of flight and a broken down Tiger Moth. Orville persuades the recluse to rebuild the Moth - and Orville’s life takes off with it!
results.creator_credit_for_label: James M. Vernon and Rolf De Heer

results.title: Taijiquan (Tai Chi): the 24 forms
results.creator_credit: East Acton Videos and Michael Ngai
results.brief_description: Tai Chi is a simple and powerfully effective art form, proven by clinical studies to help relax and yet strengthen both body and mind. Being the most popular Forms in the world today, the 24 Forms is considered to be perfectly suitable for students of almost any level of physical fitness and age. Features step by step teaching with precise and easy to follow instructions suitable for all levels of learning, 6 Qigong excerises, 7 single movements and demonstrations by medal winning instructors from Health Tai Chi Chuan.

results.title: Tai Chi (Captioned)
results.brief_description: The ancient art of Tai Chi has been practised for hundreds of years and is a valuable form of self expression which helps the mind and body to relax. Tai Chi has become increasingly popular in the often stressful framework of twentieth century living. It aims to develop a strong co-ordinated body which is able to function in a relaxed, calm manner at all times. This video methodically guides us through each graceful movement, clearly emphasising the careful attention which must be given to posture. Master Erle Montaigue, one of the foremost authorities on the original Yang style of Tai Chi, demonstrates and discusses the movements with the viewer and reaffirms its healing powers which contribute to that special sense of well-being.

results.title: Tai-pan = Tai pan
results.creator_credit: De Laurentiis Entertainment Group, Raffaella De Laurentiis and Daryl Duke
results.brief_description: Tai-Pan is an epic adventure-romance set against the backdrop of the founding of Hong Kong as a British colony, circa 1842, in response to the opium wars between Britain and China. The plot revolves around an unscrupulous merchant trader Dirk Struan (Bryan Brown), and his long-standing feud with a rival merchant as each battles for supremacy as the ruling British merchant, or Tai-Pan, of Hong Kong. Over the years their bitter rivalry between the two men becomes murderous resulting eventually in a momentous showdown. Based on James Clavell’s ambitious novel of the same name (the first of his Noble House series), the film simplifies the book’s intricate sub-plots, only partially succeeding in capturing the spirit, depth and complexity of its source. Cast also includes Joan Chen, John Stanton and Bill Leadbitter.

results.title: Tahiti: pacific cocktail
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Commission, Ivan Chapman, Neil Edwards and John Gray
results.brief_description: A report, as the ABC’s contribution to the International Television Federation, on Tahiti, emphasising the decision of the French Government to expand tourism as an economic measure.
